header.h2: PDE REQUIRES ALL SCHOOLS TO MOVE TO PLANNED INSTRUCTION

div.p: Late last week, Pedro Rivera, Secretary of Education announced that ALL schools at ALL grade levels were expected to provide Planned Instruction for the remainder of the school year. As this is a change for our students over the next several weeks, we will continue to provide the current options (packets or online learning) for students with the added requirements of attendance and accountability for completing work. New requirements will take effect on Monday, April 27th. Please click "Read full story" to access a parent letter dated April 21 detailing our plan moving forward.

img.h1: Marion Center Area School District Home

article.aria-label: PDE REQUIRES ALL SCHOOLS TO MOVE TO PLANNED INSTRUCTION

h3.a: PDE REQUIRES ALL SCHOOLS TO MOVE TO PLANNED INSTRUCTION

div.div: Late last week, Pedro Rivera, Secretary of Education announced that ALL schools at ALL grade levels were expected to provide Planned Instruction for the remainder of the school year. As this is a change for our students over the next several weeks, we will continue to provide the current options (packets or online learning) for students with the added requirements of attendance and accountability for completing work. New requirements will take effect on Monday, April 27th. Please click "Read full story" to access a parent letter dated April 21 detailing our plan moving forward.

Marion Center Area Board of Directors will hold the April School Board Meetings on Monday, April 20, 2020 at 7:00 p.m. and April 27, 2020 at 7:30 p.m. as Zoom meetings. Please click on "Read full story" for more information on how to access the meeting.

article.aria-label: School Closed for the 19-20 School Year/Packet Pick Up Monday, April 13th

h3.a: School Closed for the 19-20 School Year/Packet Pick Up Monday, April 13th

div.div: Due to the announcement that PA schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year, the district will be issuing the second round of Academic Packets on Monday, April 13th. Pick up at Rayne will be in the front circle. Pick up at the High School will be in front of the Gymnasium Entrance. McCreery pick up will be moved down near the playground circle due to the predicted rain and wind that is in the forecast. If you indicated that you need packets, rather than online instruction, please pick them up between 8AM - 11AM. If you cannot make it at that time, extra packets for all buildings will be placed in the HS Auditorium entrance for pick up at your convenience.

The district will be distributing a limited # of hams on Saturday morning starting at 8 AM for our struggling families in need for the holiday weekend. Pick will be on a first come, first serve basis at the cafe/pool doors.
The mission of the Marion Center Area School District is to serve the community by
challenging and educating all students to be responsible and productive citizens of a global society.
The vision of the Marion Center Area School District is to be recognized as an innovative
learning community where students will be educated as leaders in the areas of
academics, arts, athletics, character, citizenship, and vocational skills.
Please contact me with any questions and concerns at 724-397-5551 Ext. 5000.
